title: A Tragic Crime That Brought Answers and Healing
text:
Emily Pittsford shares of losing her son and finding hope in new book
El Cajon, Calif. (PRWEB) October 20, 2015
Life is never promised and in a blink of an eye, anything can happen. Emily Pittsford’s heart seemed to stop when she found out that her son, Tim, had suddenly passed away. In that moment so much confusion, anticipation, and grief immediately hit. She was at a loss for words.
It was days before the tragic news that Tim had reached out to her explaining that he had witnessed a hit-and-run in the streets of San Francisco, where a woman was killed in a crosswalk. He had chased the car to only get a glimpse of the plate, which he eventually turned into the police.
How was he dead? How could this be? What happens now?
In Pittsford new book “A Most Incredible Witness,” she answers all of those questions. Readers will follow the life of a mother who fights inward battles, yet perseveres knowing that God is using her story to reach many.
“In my book, I have opened my soul and exposed my pain for everyone to see,” Pittsford said.
Through her raw words, attention-grabbing story, and love for her children – many individuals will be captivated through Pittsford’s story and feel like they have known her for years.
“I wrote this book to share of God’s incredible providence for our son, Tim. God used Tim to witness the crash so that he would eventually find his way back in God’s arms,” Pittsford said.
“A Most Incredible Witness,” will not only remind readers that God has always loved them, but especially in our last moments, he is romancing us back to him. Join Pittsford on her journey and watch the power of God working.
“A Most Incredible Witness”
By: Emily Pittsford
ISBN: 978-1-51270-571-3
Available in softcover, hardcover, e-book

About the author
Emily Pittsford, author of “A Most Incredible Witness,” lives in California with her husband and dogs. After losing her son, Pittsford decided to share her story of grief in her book, “A Most Incredible Witness.” Currently, Pittsford and her husband travel around the United States supporting their daughter and her events. She is also an antique dealer in the El Cajon area who refurbishes furniture.
